Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 404.
_description: I take my leve agaynst my wyll’ — four 8-line stanzas, including refrain, ‘I take my leve agaynst my wyll’ with ‘farewell’

BodRawC813.First Lines:
fare well now my lady gayefarewell floure freshest of
                    hew…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…farewell god bryng yow to his blysseI take my leve a gaynst
                    my wyll

Banna.First Lines:
Allace depairting grund of woThow art of euerilk Ioy ane
                    end…
Banna.Last Lines:
…ffair weill þe nvreis of gentilnessI tak my leif aganis
                    my will
Banna.Note:
Variant version: stanzas 2-4 = 1-3 of usual 767; lines 1,3 v. similar to
                    lines 1, 3 of 270.
